inputs:
Q: Does United Airlines have a perfect operation record?
A:
targets: No. An airline with a perfect operation record has no crashes or other damaging incidents. United Airlines has had over 30 crash incidents over several decades.

inputs:
Q: Is Metallica protective over their music?
A:
targets: Yes. Napster was a P2P music sharing service. Metallica sued Napster in order to remove their songs from the program, as they were not getting profit from it.

inputs:
Q: Would Jimmy Vee be eligible to compete in the Paralympic Games?
A:
targets: Yes. Jimmy Vee is a dwarf. Dwarfism is defined as someone who is medically short-statured. Short stature due to a bone deficiency is one of the categories for paralympic athletes.

inputs:
Q: Does Disney have an ice princess?
A:
targets: Yes. In 2013, Disney released Frozen. Frozen features Elsa, a princess with magical ice powers.

inputs:
Q: Was historical Dracula from a town in Bucharest?
A:
targets: No. Vlad III Prince of Wallachia, also called Vlad the Impaler, is believed to be the historical inspiration for Dracula. Vlad III was born in Sighișoara, Romania, which is located in the historic region of Transylvania. Bucharest is located 276 km away from Transylvania.

inputs:
Q: Would a modern central processing unit circuit chip fit on a housekey?
A:
targets: No. A CPU circuit chip is about an inch across. A housekey is generally less than a half-inch across.

inputs:
Q: Are most books written as a Haiku?
A:
targets: No. Haiku is a very short poem. Haiku is written with 3 short phrases.

inputs:
Q: Did any citizen of San Antonio vote for Boris Johnson?
A:
targets: No. San Antonio is a city in Texas in the United States of America. Boris Johnson is the Prime Minister of the UK. Only UK and commonwealth citizens may vote in UK elections.

inputs:
Q: Could the Great Wall of China connect the Dodgers to the White Sox?
A:
targets: Yes. The Dodgers are a baseball team located in Los Angeles. The White Sox are a baseball team located in Chicago. The distance between Los Angeles and Chicago is 2,015 miles. The length of the main section of the Great Wall of China is 2,145 miles.

inputs:
Q: Is RoboCop director from same country as Gaite Jansen?
A:
targets: Yes. Robocop was directed by Paul Verhoeven. Paul Verhoeven was born in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Gaite Jansen is an actress known for Jett and Peaky Blinders and was born in Rotterdam, Netherlands.

inputs:
Q: Did producer of Easy Rider ever star in a movie with Dean Cain's Princeton girlfriend?
A:
targets: Yes. Easy Rider was produced by Peter Fonda. Dean Cain dated Brooke Shields while at Princeton. Brooke Shields and Peter Fonda star in the movie Wanda Nevada.

inputs:
Q: Is the tongue part of a creature's head?
A:
targets: Yes. A creature's tongue is inside its mouth. A creature's mouth is part of its head.

inputs:
Q: Did Columbus obtain his funding from the rulers of the Portugese Empire?
A:
targets: No.  King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella funded Columbus' voyage to the New World. King Ferdinand of Argon and Queen Isabella of Castille were the joint rulers of kingdoms of the Iberian Peninsula, which included modern-day Spain but excludes Portugal.  King John II of Portugal rejected Columbus' request for funding.

inputs:
Q: Are the brooms from curling good for using on house floors?
A:
targets: No. Curling brooms are designed for use within the sport specifically.  Curling brooms do not have traditional bristle heads, and the heads are costly to replace.

inputs:
Q: Could a white belt defeat Jon Jones in a Brazilian jiu-jitsu match?
A:
targets: No. A white belt is the lowest ranking in Brazilian jiu-jitsu. Jon Jones has a purple belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu under Roberto Alencar. A purple belt is the second highest ranking in Brazilian jiu-jitsu. Jon Jones is one of the greatest combat sports athletes to ever live.

inputs:
Q: Would you find a tibia beside parsley on a holiday plate?
A:
targets: Yes. The tibia of a goat is eaten during Passover, a Jewish holiday. Parsley is served on a Passover seder plate beside the goat shank .

inputs:
Q: Could a monolingual American read Lenovo's native name?
A:
targets: No. Lenovo's native name is 联想集团有限公司. Someone who is monolingual only speaks one language. The typical monolingual American would only be able to read English. Someone who can only read English is therefore unable to read Chinese.

inputs:
Q: Does a kangaroo incubate its offspring?
A:
targets: No. Incubation is the process of hatching offspring from eggs. Kangaroos are mammals. Mammals give birth to live offspring.

inputs:
Q: Was Amazon involved in the lunar landing?
A:
targets: No. The lunar landing occurred in 1969. Amazon was founded in 1994.

inputs:
Q: Does frost mean that it will be a snowy day?
A:
targets: No. Frost forms regularly in areas that experience freezing temperatures and morning dew. Frost isn't deposited from the sky like snow, it forms on the ground.

inputs:
Q: Do Squidward Tentacles and Alan Greenspan have different musical passions?
A:
targets: No. Squidward Tentacles plays the clarinet. Alan Greenspan played clarinet and saxophone along with Stan Getz. Alan Greenspan studied clarinet at the Juilliard School from 1943 to 1944.

inputs:
Q: Would dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry be useful if performed on a crab?
A:
targets: No. Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry is typically used to diagnose and follow osteoporosis. Osteoporosis is a disease in which bone weakening increases the risk of a broken bone. Crabs are invertebrates. Invertebrates do not have bones.

inputs:
Q: Are Brian Cranston and Saoirse Ronan's combined Emmy Awards a prime number?
A:
targets: No. Brian Cranston has won 6 Emmy Awards. Saoirse Ronan has won 0 Emmy awards. 6 is divisible by the following numbers: 1,2,3, and 6.

inputs:
Q: Would it be difficult for Will Ferrell to win Empire Award for Best Newcomer?
A:
targets: Yes. The Empire Award for Best Newcomer was awarded for an actor in their debut role. Will Ferrell debuted in 1995.

inputs:
Q: Would you have to wear a coat when on Phobos?
A:
targets: Yes. A coat is a garment used to keep a person warm. The surface temperatures on Phobos range from about −4 °C (25 °F) on the sunlit side to −112 °C (−170 °F) on the shadowed side.

inputs:
Q: Will Conan the Barbarian hypothetically last a short time inside of Call of Duty?
A:
targets: Yes. Conan the Barbarian is a comic book character. Conan the Barbarian is equipped with a sword and does not typically wear armor. Call of Duty is a modern warfare video game. Soldiers in Call of Duty are equipped with weapons like sniper rifles, shotguns, and machine guns.

inputs:
Q: Would a snakebite hypothetically be a threat to T-1000?
A:
targets: No. Snakebites are dangerous because they inject venom into blood streams. The T-1000 is an android from the movie series Terminator. Androids are machines made of wires and computer parts.

inputs:
Q: Can you see live harbor seals in Washington DC?
A:
targets: Yes. The Smithsonian National Zoo is in Washington DC. There is a harbor seal exhibit at the Smithsonian National Zoo.

inputs:
Q: Is the Foreign and Commonwealth Office a European political agency?
A:
targets: Yes. The Office is part of the government of the United Kingdom. The United Kingdom is in Europe.

inputs:
Q: Is myocardial infarction a brain problem?
A:
targets: No. Myocardial infarction is a problem in the heart. The equivalent in the brain would be similar to a stroke.

inputs:
Q: Do most people only memorize slightly over half of their ZIP code?
A:
targets: Yes. ZIP codes in the US are 9 digits in length.  Most forms in the US only require and have space for the first 5 digits of a ZIP code?.

inputs:
Q: Are LinkedIn and LeafedIn related companies?
A:
targets: No. LinkedIn successfully sued LeafedIn for their choice of name. LeafedIn changed their company name to LeafedOut.

inputs:
Q: Did the Football War last at least a month?
A:
targets: No. The Football War began on July 14 1969. It ended on July 20 1969. Therefore, it did not even last a whole week.

inputs:
Q: Is Gandalf hypothetically a formidable foe for Charmed's Barbas?
A:
targets: No. Gandalf was a wizard in the Hobbit and Lord of the Rings series. Gandalf used his staff to cast powerful spells. Barbas was a demon on Charmed that had resistance to magic.

inputs:
Q: Does Paulo Coelho's wife make a living through speech?
A:
targets: No. Paulo Coelho's wife is Christina Oiticica. Christina Oiticica is a Brazilian artist. Artists make a living through drawing things, which is done by their hands. Speech is typically performed with one's mouth.

inputs:
Q: Will Dustin Hoffman likely vote for Trump in 2020?
A:
targets: No. Dustin Hoffman is a liberal and has long supported the Democratic Party and Ralph Nader. Donald Trump belongs to the Republican Party.

inputs:
Q: Did Ada Lovelace die tragically young for her era?
A:
targets: No. Ada Lovelace died at the age of 36 in 1852. The life expectancy in the 1800s was between 35 and 39 years old. Tuberculosis was one of the leading causes of death in the 1800s and a vaccine was not made until the 1900s.

inputs:
Q: Does Nicole Kidman despise Roman Josi?
A:
targets: No. Nicole Kidman supports the Nashville Predators and has been photographed almost nightly throughout the season. Roman Josi is a Swiss professional ice hockey defenceman who currently serves as captain of the Nashville Predators.

inputs:
Q: Does a Disney princess on Broadway have red hair?
A:
targets: Yes. Ariel, the princess from Disney's the Little Mermaid, has red hair. The Little Mermaid is one of several Disney animated classics that was adapted for the stage and performed on Broadway.

inputs:
Q: Do Muslims have a different idea of Seraphim than Christians?
A:
targets: No. Seraphim are celestial of heavenly beings. Christians refer to Seraphims as the highest choir of the angelic hierarchy and caretakers of God's throne. Muslims refer to Seraphim as beings created from celestial fire that are part of an exalted assembly.

inputs:
Q: Could the surface of Europa fry an egg?
A:
targets: No. Europa is known for having an icy surface. For an egg to become firm, the ground must be at least 158 degrees Fahrenheit.  Ice forms at 32 degrees Fahrenheit. Europa's temperatures are all in the negatives on the Fahrenheit scale.

inputs:
Q: Could the Great Wall of China connect the Dodgers to the White Sox?
A:
targets: Yes. The Dodgers are a baseball team located in Los Angeles. The White Sox are a baseball team located in Chicago. The distance between Los Angeles and Chicago is 2,015 miles. The length of the main section of the Great Wall of China is 2,145 miles.

inputs:
Q: If you bottle your own milk, would there be cream on top of it?
A:
targets: Yes. Milk that has been bottled straight from a cow has not been homogenized.  Homogenization causes the fats in milk to become emulsified. Non-homogenized milk will feature fats that separate and float to the top. The fats in non-homogenized milk are cream.

inputs:
Q: Are the Great Lakes part of an international border?
A:
targets: Yes. The lakes are bordered on the north by Canada. The lakes are bordered on the south by United States. Canada and United States are two different countries.

inputs:
Q: Would Immanuel Kant be disgusted by the Black Lives Matter movement?
A:
targets: Yes. Immanuel Kant believed that Africans occupied the second lowest position on his racial hierarchy, below Whites and Asians. The Black Lives Matter movement advocates for racial equality and anti-racism.

inputs:
Q: Is the CIA part of the Department of Defense?
A:
targets: No. The Department of Defense covers national defense and the armed forces, led by the Secretary of Defense. The CIA is a federal agency within the United States Intelligence Community, which answers to the Director of National Intelligence.

inputs:
Q: Can Ford F-350 tow entire Yale University student body?
A:
targets: No. The Yale University student body consists of 12,385 people according to a 2015 poll. The average US male weighs 195 pounds. The average US female weighs 168 pounds. The maximum towing capacity of the Ford F-350 is 15,000 pounds.

inputs:
Q: Could Jamie Brewer have attended the United States Naval Academy?
A:
targets: No. Jamie Brewer is a famous actress with down syndrome. Individuals with down syndrome are disqualified from military service.

inputs:
Q: Can an African Elephant get pregnant twice in a year?
A:
targets: No. There are 365 days in one year. It takes around 645 days for an African Elephant to give birth to one baby elephant.

inputs:
Q: Would Brian Warner be a good singer for a soul music band?
A:
targets: No. Soul music is a music genre that originated in the United States African American community in the 1950s. Soul music combines elements of African-American gospel music, rhythm and blues and jazz. Brian Warner is the lead singer of the band Marilyn Manson. The band Marilyn Manson plays industrial heavy metal music.
